frameDefinitions: A Killer or Cause causes the death of the Victim.

An Agent or Potential_hindrance keeps a Protagonist from having a State_of_affairs that they need or desire, or, despite the possibility of preventing the possession, they allow the Protagonist to have the State_of_affairs.
An Item is in a state of dryness.
A Figure is characterized as near the Ground, according to some contextually given scale.
A Speaker uses language to affirm or deny the truth of a Message to some Addressee.
An Agent causes a Hidden_object to become perceptually inaccessible to potential perceivers by placing it in a Hiding_place or putting in place an Obstruction that screens the object.
frameExamples: His parents <t>deprived</t> him of food for days on end.
She put her shoes <t>under</t> the table .
She <t>affirmed</t> her loyalty to the cause.
Therefore, as I passed the school, I <t>hid</t> the gun and holster in the mailbox
listRoleDefinitions: The person or sentient entity that causes the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The living entity that dies as a result of the killing.
An inanimate entity or process that causes the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The method or action that the <fen>Killer</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> performs resulting in the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The device used by the <fen>Killer</fen> to bring about the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The point or period of time within which the <fen>Victim</fen> is killed.
The location where the death took place.
The <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> is the force which keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening, or does not prevent it.
The  is the situation, state-of-affairs, or state of having a possession that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is kept from having.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the  person who keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening.
The <fen>Protagonist</fen> is the person who is kept from having the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.
The <fen>Item</fen> exists in a state of dryness.
The <fen>Ground</fen> serves as a basis for describing the location of the <fen>Figure</fen>.
The <fen>Figure</fen> is perceived as located relative to a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location. The figure can be an entity or an event.
The period of time during which the locative relation between <fen>Figure</fen> and <fen>Ground</fen> obtains.

The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity affirming or denying the truth of the <fen>Message</fen> (this can be spoken or written). It is normally expressed as the External Argument of the predicative uses of the target word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun.
The <fen>Message</fen> identifies the content whose truth the <fen>Speaker</fen> is affirming or denying. It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the <fen>Message</fen>.

The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is rarely mentioned in constructions with verbal targets, and is much more common with nominal targets, where it is usually expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'of' or about'.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Message</fen> is affirmed or denied.
<fen>Place</fen> specifies the location where the <fen>Message</fen> is affirmed or denied.
The <fen>Hidden_object</fen> is the entity which is blocked from view.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who causes the Hidden_entity to be not perceptually accessible to potential perceivers.
The location in which the <fen>Hidden_object</fen> is placed so as not to be perceptually accessible.
<fen>Time</fen> denotes the interval of time during which the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Hidden_object</fen> to become hidden from perceptual access.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the spatial setting in which the hiding event takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The rockslide</fex> killed nearly half of the climbers.
The flood exterminated the rats <fex>by cutting off access to food</fex>.
It's difficult to suicide <fex>with only a pocketknife</fex>.
There is no evidence that the royal family was killed <fex>during the destruction</fex> at this site.
Apparently there were two murders <fex>in Atherton</fex> in one week.
<fex>Israeli law</fex> effectively deprived the owners of their homes and lands.
Their parents denied them <fex>a brand new car</fex> upon their sweet 16.
<fex>The uncaring King Frank</fex> often starves his citizens of tax relief.
The cat is next to <fex>the mat</fex>.
<fex>The cat</fex> is next to the mat.
He was by the park <fex>on Friday</fex>.
No one believed <fex>Evelyn</fex>'s affirmation that she could speak to ghosts.
They refute the criticisms <fex>that they are only interested in power and money</fex>.

Michael Jackson gave wine to the 13-year-old cancer patient at the center of
the molestation charges he's battling but concealed <fex>it</fex> inside a Coke can.
<fex>The deputy</fex> concealed the bayonet under his coat.
He had concealed the necklace <fex>behind him</fex>.

passageCandidateSpans.text: Section 1002 of the American Recovery and Reinvestment

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the American Coalition for Filipino Veterans
the American Coalition of Filipino Veterans
